1.description: Client must send connection preface after TLS establishment

Variables.msg: No initial settings received from peer at 192.168.122.6:7706

2.description:
the connection preface starts with the string: PRI * HTTP/2.0

SM

3.description: Client preface must include a SETTINGS frame

Variables.msg: Connection terminated by peer: Received GOAWAY frame after sending 1 of 1 frames. Error code 1. Additional data: b'SETTINGS expected'.

4.description: Values greater than 16,384 MUST NOT be sent unless receiver has set larger SETTINGS_MAX_FRAME_SIZE

Variables.msg: Connection terminated by peer: Received GOAWAY frame after sending 2 of 2 frames. Error code 6. Additional data: b'too large frame size'.

5.description: The frame type determines the format and semantics of the frame. Implementations MUST ignore and discard frames of unknown types.

6.description: A reserved 1-bit field. The semantics of this bit are undefined, and the bit MUST remain unset (0x00) when sending and MUST be ignored when receiving.

7.description: Receiving any frame other than HEADERS or PRIORITY on a stream in this (idle) state MUST be treated as a connection error (Section 5.4.1) of type PROTOCOL_ERROR.

Variables.msg: Connection terminated by peer: Received GOAWAY frame with error code 1. Additional data: b'DATA: stream in idle'.

8.description: If an endpoint receives additional frames, other than WINDOW_UPDATE, PRIORITY, or RST_STREAM, for a stream that is in the half-closed (remote) state, it MUST respond with a stream error (Section 5.4.2) of type STREAM_CLOSED.

Variables.msg: Connection terminated by peer: Received GOAWAY frame with error code 5. Additional data: b'DATA: stream in half-closed(remote)'.

9.description: An endpoint MUST NOT send frames other than PRIORITY on a closed stream.

10.description: Streams initiated by a client MUST use odd-numbered stream identifiers.

Variables.msg: Connection terminated by peer: Received GOAWAY frame with error code 1. Additional data: b'request HEADERS: invalid stream_id'.

11.description: The identifier of a newly established stream MUST be numerically greater than all streams that the initiating endpoint has opened or reserved.

12.description: DATA frames MUST be associated with a stream.

Variables.msg: Connection terminated by peer: Received GOAWAY frame with error code 1. Additional data: b'DATA: stream in idle'.

13.description: If a DATA frame is received whose Stream Identifier field is 0x00, the recipient MUST respond with a connection error (Section 5.4.1) of type PROTOCOL_ERROR.

Variables.msg: Connection terminated by peer: Received GOAWAY frame with error code 1. Additional data: b'DATA: stream_id == 0'.

14.description: If a DATA frame is received whose stream is not in the 'open' or 'half-closed (local)' state, the recipient MUST respond with a stream error (Section 5.4.2) of type STREAM_CLOSED. (Tested in the idle state.)

Variables.msg: Connection terminated by peer: Received GOAWAY frame with error code 1. Additional data: b'DATA: stream in idle'.

15.description: If a DATA frame is received whose stream is not in the 'open' or 'half-closed (local)' state, the recipient MUST respond with a stream error (Section 5.4.2) of type STREAM_CLOSED. (Tested in the half-closed (remote) state.)

Variables.msg: Connection terminated by peer: Received GOAWAY frame with error code 5. Additional data: b'DATA: stream in half-closed(remote)'.

16.description: If a DATA frame is received whose stream is not in the 'open' or 'half-closed (local)' state, the recipient MUST respond with a stream error (Section 5.4.2) of type STREAM_CLOSED. (Tested in the closed state.)

17.description: A HEADERS frame without the END_HEADERS flag set MUST be followed by a CONTINUATION frame for the same stream.

Variables.msg: Connection terminated by peer: Received GOAWAY frame with error code 1. Additional data: b'unexpected non-CONTINUATION frame or stream_id is invalid'.

18.description: If a HEADERS frame is received whose Stream Identifier field is 0x00, the recipient MUST respond with a connection error (Section 5.4.1) of type PROTOCOL_ERROR.

Variables.msg: Connection terminated by peer: Received GOAWAY frame with error code 1. Additional data: b'request HEADERS: stream_id == 0'.

19.description: If a PRIORITY frame is received with a stream identifier of 0x00, the recipient MUST respond with a connection error of type PROTOCOL_ERROR

Variables.msg: Connection terminated by peer: Received GOAWAY frame with error code 1. Additional data: b'PRIORITY: stream_id == 0'.

20.description: If a RST_STREAM frame is received with a stream identifier of 0x00, the recipient MUST treat this as a connection error (Section 5.4.1) of type PROTOCOL_ERROR.

Variables.msg: Connection terminated by peer: Received GOAWAY frame with error code 1. Additional data: b'RST_STREAM: stream_id == 0'.

21.description: A RST_STREAM frame with a length other than 4 octets MUST be treated as a connection error (Section 5.4.1) of type FRAME_SIZE_ERROR.

Variables.msg: Connection terminated by peer: Received GOAWAY frame with error code 6. Additional data: None.

22.description: RST_STREAM frames MUST NOT be sent for a stream in the 'idle' state.

Variables.msg: Connection terminated by peer: Received GOAWAY frame with error code 1. Additional data: b'RST_STREAM: stream in idle'.

23.description: RST_STREAM frames MUST be associated with a stream.

Variables.msg: Connection terminated by peer: Received GOAWAY frame with error code 1. Additional data: b'RST_STREAM: stream in idle'.

24.description: When set, the ACK flag indicates that this frame acknowledges receipt and application of the peer's SETTINGS frame. When this bit is set, the frame payload of the SETTINGS frame MUST be empty.

Variables.msg: Connection terminated by peer: Received GOAWAY frame with error code 6. Additional data: None.

25.description: The stream identifier for a SETTINGS frame MUST be zero (0x00).

Variables.msg: Connection terminated by peer: Received GOAWAY frame with error code 1. Additional data: b'SETTINGS: stream_id != 0'.

26.description: A SETTINGS frame with a length other than a multiple of 6 octets MUST be treated as a connection error (Section 5.4.1) of type FRAME_SIZE_ERROR.

Variables.msg: Connection terminated by peer: Received GOAWAY frame with error code 6. Additional data: None.

27.description: The initial value of SETTINGS_ENABLE_PUSH is 1. Any value other than 0 or 1 MUST be treated as a connection error (Section 5.4.1) of type PROTOCOL_ERROR.

Variables.msg: Connection terminated by peer: Received GOAWAY frame with error code 1. Additional data: b'SETTINGS: invalid SETTINGS_ENBLE_PUSH'.

28.description: For SETTINGS_INITIAL_WINDOW_SIZE, values above the maximum flow-control window size of 2^31-1 (2147483647) MUST be treated as a connection error (Section 5.4.1) of type FLOW_CONTROL_ERROR.

Variables.msg: Connection terminated by peer: Received GOAWAY frame with error code 3. Additional data: b'SETTINGS: too large SETTINGS_INITIAL_WINDOW_SIZE'.

29.description: The value advertised by an endpoint MUST be between initial value (2^14 = 16,384) and maximum allowed frame size (2^24-1 = 16,777,215 octets), inclusive.

Variables.msg: Connection terminated by peer: Received GOAWAY frame with error code 1. Additional data: b'SETTINGS: invalid SETTINGS_MAX_FRAME_SIZE'.

30.description: An endpoint that receives a SETTINGS frame with any unknown or unsupported identifier MUST ignore that setting.

32.description: If a PING frame is received with a Stream Identifier field value other than 0x00, the recipient MUST respond with a connection error (Section 5.4.1) of type PROTOCOL_ERROR.

Variables.msg: Connection terminated by peer: Received GOAWAY frame with error code 1. Additional data: b'PING: stream_id != 0'.

33.description: A receiver MUST treat the receipt of a WINDOW_UPDATE frame with a flow-control window increment of 0 as a stream error (Section 5.4.2) of type PROTOCOL_ERROR.

Variables.msg: Connection terminated by peer: Received GOAWAY frame with error code 1. Additional data: b'WINDOW_UPDATE: window_size_increment == 0'.

34.description: A sender MUST NOT allow a flow-control window to exceed 2^31-1 octets. If a sender receives a WINDOW_UPDATE that causes a flow-control window to exceed this maximum, it MUST terminate either the stream or the connection, as appropriate.

Variables.msg: Connection terminated by peer: Received GOAWAY frame with error code 3. Additional data: None.

35.description: The sender MUST NOT send a flow-controlled frame with a length that exceeds the space available in either of the flow-control windows advertised by the receiver.

36.description: If a CONTINUATION frame is received with a Stream Identifier field of 0x00, the recipient MUST respond with a connection error (Section 5.4.1) of type PROTOCOL_ERROR.

Variables.msg: Connection terminated by peer: Received GOAWAY frame with error code 1. Additional data: b'unexpected non-CONTINUATION frame or stream_id is invalid'.

37.description: A CONTINUATION frame MUST be preceded by a HEADERS, PUSH_PROMISE or CONTINUATION frame without the END_HEADERS flag set. (Using HEADERS frame with END_HEADERS flag set)

Variables.msg: Connection terminated by peer: Received GOAWAY frame with error code 1. Additional data: b'CONTINUATION: unexpected'.

38.description: CONTINUATION frames MUST be associated with a stream.

Variables.msg: Connection terminated by peer: Received GOAWAY frame with error code 1. Additional data: b'CONTINUATION: unexpected'.

39.description: If the END_HEADERS flag is not set, this frame MUST be followed by another CONTINUATION frame. A receiver MUST treat the receipt of any other type of frame or a frame on a different stream as a connection error (Section 5.4.1) of type PROTOCOL_ERROR.

Variables.msg: Connection terminated by peer: Received GOAWAY frame with error code 1. Additional data: b'unexpected non-CONTINUATION frame or stream_id is invalid'.

40.description: Trailers MUST NOT include pseudo-header fields (Section 8.3).

41.description: Other frames (from any stream) MUST NOT occur between the HEADERS frame and any CONTINUATION frames that might follow.

Variables.msg: Connection terminated by peer: Received GOAWAY frame with error code 1. Additional data: b'unexpected non-CONTINUATION frame or stream_id is invalid'.

42.description: An endpoint that receives a HEADERS frame without the END_STREAM flag set after receiving the HEADERS frame that opens a request or after receiving a final (non-informational) status code MUST treat the corresponding request or response as malformed (Section 8.1.1).

43.description: Field names MUST be converted to lowercase when constructing an HTTP/2 message.

44.description: Field names MUST NOT contain control characters (0x00-0x1F)

45.description: Field names MUST NOT contain ASCII SP (0x20)

46.description: Field names MUST NOT contain DEL character (0x7F)

47.description: Field names MUST NOT contain high byte characters (0x80-0xFF)

48.description: With the exception of pseudo-header fields (Section 8.3), which have a name that starts with a single colon, field names MUST NOT include a colon (ASCII COLON, 0x3a).

49.description: A field value MUST NOT contain line feed (ASCII LF, 0x0a). (Tested at the start of the value)

50.description: A field value MUST NOT contain carriage return (ASCII CR, 0x0d). (Tested at the start of the value)

51.description: A field value MUST NOT start with an ASCII whitespace character (ASCII SP or HTAB, 0x20 or 0x09).

52.description: A field value MUST NOT end with an ASCII whitespace character (ASCII SP or HTAB, 0x20 or 0x09).

53.description: A field value MUST NOT contain line feed (ASCII LF, 0x0a). (Tested at the middle of the value)

54.description: A field value MUST NOT contain line feed (ASCII LF, 0x0a). (Tested at the end of the value)

55.description: A field value MUST NOT contain carriage return (ASCII CR, 0x0d). (Tested at the middle of the value)

56.description: A field value MUST NOT contain carriage return (ASCII CR, 0x0d). (Tested at the end of the value)

57.description: An endpoint MUST NOT generate an HTTP/2 message containing connection header field (RFC9113 Section 8.2.2)

58.description: An endpoint MUST NOT generate an HTTP/2 message containing proxy-connection header field (RFC9113 Section 8.2.2)

59.description: An endpoint MUST NOT generate an HTTP/2 message containing keep-alive header field (RFC9113 Section 8.2.2)

60.description: An endpoint MUST NOT generate an HTTP/2 message containing transfer-encoding header field (RFC9113 Section 8.2.2)

61.description: An endpoint MUST NOT generate an HTTP/2 message containing upgrade header field (RFC9113 Section 8.2.2)

62.description: The TE header field MAY be present in an HTTP/2 request; when it is, it MUST NOT contain any value other than 'trailers'.

63.description: Pseudo-header fields are not HTTP header fields. Endpoints MUST NOT generate pseudo-header fields other than those defined in this document.

64.description: Pseudo-header fields defined for responses MUST NOT appear in requests.

65.description: All pseudo-header fields sent from a client MUST appear in a field block before all regular field lines. Any request or response that contains a pseudo-header field that appears in a field block after a regular field line MUST be treated as malformed (Section 8.1.1).

66.description: The same pseudo-header field name MUST NOT appear more than once in a field block. A field block for an HTTP request or response that contains a repeated pseudo-header field name MUST be treated as malformed (Section 8.1.1). Tested with a request frame with the same value.

67.description: The same pseudo-header field name MUST NOT appear more than once in a field block. A field block for an HTTP request or response that contains a repeated pseudo-header field name MUST be treated as malformed (Section 8.1.1). Tested with a request frame with different values.

68.description: Clients MUST NOT generate a request with a Host header field that differs from the ":authority" pseudo-header field.

69.description: ':authority' MUST NOT include the deprecated userinfo subcomponent for "http" or "https" schemed URIs.

70.description: The ":path" pseudo-header field MUST NOT be empty for "http" or "https" URIs; "http" or "https" URIs that do not contain a path component MUST include a value of '/'.

71.description: All HTTP/2 requests MUST include exactly one valid value for the ":method", ":scheme", and ":path" pseudo-header fields, unless they are CONNECT requests (Section 8.5). An HTTP request that omits mandatory pseudo-header fields is malformed (Section 8.1.1). (Tested with :method missing)

72.description: All HTTP/2 requests MUST include exactly one valid value for the ":method", ":scheme", and ":path" pseudo-header fields, unless they are CONNECT requests (Section 8.5). An HTTP request that omits mandatory pseudo-header fields is malformed (Section 8.1.1). (Tested with :scheme missing)

73.description: All HTTP/2 requests MUST include exactly one valid value for the ":method", ":scheme", and ":path" pseudo-header fields, unless they are CONNECT requests (Section 8.5). An HTTP request that omits mandatory pseudo-header fields is malformed (Section 8.1.1). (Tested with :path missing)

74.description: A client cannot push. Thus, servers MUST treat the receipt of a PUSH_PROMISE frame as a connection error (Section 5.4.1) of type PROTOCOL_ERROR.

Variables.msg: Connection terminated by peer: Received GOAWAY frame with error code 1. Additional data: b'PUSH_PROMISE: push disabled'.

75.description: With the CONNECT method, the " :scheme" and " :path" pseudo-header fields MUST be omitted. (Tested with only :path present)

76.description: With the CONNECT method, the " :scheme" and " :path" pseudo-header fields MUST be omitted. (Tested with only :scheme present)

77.description: With the CONNECT method, the ":scheme" and ":path" pseudo-header fields MUST be omitted. (Tested with both present)

78.description: With the CONNECT method, The ":authority" pseudo-header field contains the host and port to connect to
